scripts.build:win: npm run clean:builds32 && npm run build -- --platform win32 --arch ia32
scripts.test: npm run test:lint && npm run test:unit
scripts.installer:win: node ./scripts/create-windows-build.js && npm run clean:builds32 && npm run build:contrib && npm run build:win && grunt create-windows-installer:ia32
scripts.installer:debian: npm run clean:builds64 && npm run build:contrib && npm run build:linux && grunt electron-installer-debian
scripts.installer:dmg: npm run clean:builds64 && npm run build:contrib && npm run build:macos && node ./scripts/create-osx-build.js
scripts.installer:mas: npm run clean:builds64 && npm run build:contrib && npm run build:mas && node ./scripts/create-mas-build.js

commit.message:
:zap: Initial Commit

 * Ember 2.3.0
 * Ember-Electron 1.0
 * Basic Grunt Validation

releases.name: Unhappy the land that is in need of heroes.
releases.body:
Hi there ðŸ‘‹ We heard about some issues in our last release, so we're squeezing a few bug fixes in before we're working on more features.

#### Changelog:
 - New feature: :tada: You can now order your blogs in the quick switcher. Simply pick them up and drag them around!
 - Bugfix: ðŸ‘“ Sometimes, the vibrancy effect on macOS (the slight transparency) would get lost after a refresh. We're refreshing _extra hard_ now, ensuring that the window doesn't turn white in embarrassment.
 - Bugfix: ðŸ’Œ  Got names with cool characters? Our apologies for not respecting that, sometimes presenting you your characters in encoded form. They should now always come in a human-readable format.
 - Bugfix: :fire: On Windows, the app would sometimes refuse to quit. The window would be closed, but the process would just hang out in your task explorer. That doesn't sound too bad, but that process would also keep Ghost from starting again. That's obviously bad manners, we should be better now.
 - Bugfix: :art: If you're on Windows and sometimes noticed a thin white frame around your window, we fixed that.
 - Plumbing: ðŸ“¦ Updated to Electron 1.4.15.

releases.name: Don't be afraid of death so much as an inadequate life.
releases.body:
ðŸŽ†  Welcome to 2017! We're ready to get the new year started - and have a new release for you.

#### Changelog:
- New feature :art: Windows users will notice a super cute new frame! Black has always been cool, but together with a condensed menu, it's _the_ new look for the spring 2017 season.
- New feature: :art: Linux now has a maximize button, so that you can fill your whole screen with Ghost goodness. Sorry, we honestly didn't notice that we didn't have one until now.
- New feature :art: Deep linking for Windows and macOS is now enabled. We're not doing too much with it yet, but if you're developer, you should check out the [deep links documentation](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost-Desktop/blob/master/docs/deeplinks.md) to see what cool things you can do to interact with Ghost Desktop. We even have a little' code example: [This plugin for GitHub's Atom](https://github.com/felixrieseberg/atom-ghost) allows you to publish posts directly from the editor. We'll be doing all kinds of cool stuff with those deep links soon.
- Bugfix: :wrench: If you're running Ghost in a local network (for instance on `localhost`), you'll now be able to connect to it.
- Security: :lock: New SSL certificates mean that old versions of Ghost Desktop will soon refuse to connect to your blog, if it's running on `https`.
- Plumbing :package:: Upgrading to Electron also included an update to the latest version of Chromium.

releases.name: It's all right to hesitate if you then go ahead.
releases.body:
:wave: Well, it's us again, with yet another release.

#### Changelog:
- New feature: :art: If you're on macOS, you will notice that the blog quick switcher (the thing on the left side of the application) is now transparent. The designers over at Apple call it `vibrancy`, but we just think it looks cool.
- Bugfix: :wrench: We previously did not properly escape the credentials when passing them off to the blog. Jake Champion is the hero who alerted us to this error!
- Security: :lock: We updated to the latest version of Electron (1.4.10), which contains important security fixes. 
- Plumbing: Upgrading to Electron also included updates to our automatic update technology and the latest version of Chromium.

ðŸŽ‰  Crazy right? It feels like we got _just started_, yet here we are - the very first major release of Ghost Desktop, now matured to version 1.0.

#### Changelog:
- New feature: :art: If you're on macOS, you will notice a snazzier titlebar, leaving more space for your creativity and blog posts!
- Bugfix: :wrench: We had a bunch of issues with the automatic blog login - they should now be a thing of the past.
- Bugfix: :wrench: Deleting all blogs no longer results in a white screen (oops, sorry for that one...)
- Bugfix: :wrench: If you manage a large number of blogs, you may have noticed issues with some of them seemingly randomly unloading when you switch away. This is now fixed.
- Plumbing: :package: We upgraded to Chromium 54, Electron 1.4, Ember 2.8, and Node 6.9.

releases.name: Taking the pledge will not make bad liquor into good, but it will improve it.
releases.body:
ðŸŽ‰  This is one of our biggest releases yet - new features and small improvements everywhere! 

#### Changelog:
- New feature: ðŸ” You can now "Find in Page" - simply hit `Command + F` on macOS or `Ctrl + F` on Windows to bring up the new search bar.
- New feature: ðŸŽ¹  Speaking about keyboard shortcuts, check out the window menu for a bunch of new shortcuts - you can now navigate through your blog by just using your keyboard. `Command + N` / `Ctrl + N` takes you to your navigation settings, for instance.
- New feature: ðŸ’¨ The quick switcher can now disappear - check the window menu to toggle it.
- New feature: :zap: If you change your credentials on your blog without updating them in Ghost Desktop, we'll now walk you through updating them in this little app, too.
- New feature: :art: The blogs will now receive more pleasant colors. As always, if you don't like it, simply right-click it in the quick switcher and select `New Icon Color`.
- New feature: :art: Also, you'll see a new font in action - we're now going with your operating system's default font. That's what you're used to - and it'll load faster, too.
- Bugfix: :eyes: The "loading" indication screen is now faded out to please your eyes. Hopefully.
- Bugfix: :wrench: We improved the internals a bit, making Ghost Desktop more stable and less prone to errors.
- Plumbing: :package: Upgrade to Electron 1.3.5, Chrome 52, Node 6.3.

releases.name: Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
releases.body:
âœ¨  Shiny new components in Ghost Desktop 0.6! We fixed a few bugs, but most of the benefits will come directly out of updated and improved dependencies.

#### Changelog:
- Bugfix: Image uploads via drag & drop now work
- Bugfix: Pasting large amounts of texts is now dramatically faster
- New feature: Upgrade notifications for Ghost Core (when seen in Ghost Desktop) are now more specific which portion of your app is out of date
- New feature: You can now connect blogs behind HTTP Basic Authentication
- New feature: The macOS dmg is now _fancy_
- New developer feature: We now have release channels
- New developer feature: DMG creation and code signing instructions have been streamlined
- Plumbing: Upgrade to Electron 1.2.7, Node 6

releases.name: (Release Channel Test)
releases.body: This is just a release channel test - please ignore.

releases.name: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
releases.body:
We're ready for the summer ðŸŒ´  with a fancy new release! Included: A fairly major upgrade to Electron, the underlying engine powering Ghost Desktop, but also new features like a configurable spell checker and proper focus handling.

> :warning:  Due to an error in the auto updater in 0.4, nearly all users will have to update manually. Simply download the app below and overwrite your existing one - all settings will stick around.

#### Changelog:
- New feature: The spellchecker is now configurable, meaning that you can configure Ghost to use any of the dictionaries that your operating system has installed.
- Bugfix: If you switch back-and-forth between Ghost Desktop and another app, we'll now keep your focus around - you can now `Alt Tab` between Ghost Desktop and other apps without having to click back into the editor.
- Bugfix: The zoom configuration is now properly remembered.
- Bugfix: The auto updater will now work again ðŸ˜¢ 
- Plumbing: Upgrade to Chromium 51, Node 6, Electron 1.2

releases.name: I can live for two months on a good compliment.
releases.body:
Thanks to everyone for your support! We managed to fix a bunch of little bugs, but also added one small feature. If you're already using Ghost Desktop on OS X or Windows, you should automatically be updated.

#### Changelog:
- New feature: You can now configure a custom zoom level for the whole app. Go to the preferences to check it out!
- Bugfix: On Ubuntu, we now have a set maintainer field
- Bugfix: If you're with a network, but without a working Internet connection, the auto updater service will no longer complain about that (and instead just wait until you have a connection again)
- Bugfix: If you have links in your blog post, they used to open inside the app. Oops. That's fixed, too.
- Bugfix: Notifications now have the correct title.
- Bugfix: When a blog is deleted, we now also remove the password from the operating system's keychain.

releases.name: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
releases.body:
This release includes Ubuntu support - and some patches. But _WAIT_, it's also our public release!

> ðŸ’¡  If you ran a pre-release version on Mac OS X, please update manually. We switched our code signing certificates to a super-official Apple one, meaning that the auto updater will be unable to update you automatically if you were running any of the pre-release versions.

#### Changelog:
- New feature: We now run on Ubuntu!
- Bugfix: Contributors are now pulled during build, no longer on the client
- Bugfix: Previously, Ctrl + Alt + I would be registered globally on Windows. We fixed that.

releases.name: A gentleman is someone who knows how to play the banjo and doesn't.
releases.body:
Three quick bugfixes in this patch release:

#### Changelog:
- Bugfix: If offline, the app displayed a main process error on launch.
- Bugfix: On reload, the app would display a main process error.
- Bugfix: The "About" window sort of forgot which version the app was in.

releases.name: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
releases.body:
Getting closer to the first public-public-super-public release, we added a few small features.

#### Changelog
- Feature: Spell Checking ðŸ“ ! We're using your operating system's very own spell checker, meaning that we'll also automatically recognize the language your system is in.  
- Feature: The preferences moved to the App menu on OS X, and the File menu on Windows. That's where other apps keep them, so that's where we'll have them, too.
- Feature: If you change your blog's name after adding it to the app, we'll know notice that you changed it.
- Bugfix: If your blog name contained characters not displayed correctly in various locations in your operating system - that's now fixed.

releases.name: All generalizations are false, including this one.
releases.body:
This update is tiny, containing just three small fixes :wrench::

#### Changelog
- On OS X, closing the window would occasionally crash the app.
- On Windows, the auto-update service would keep the app occasionally from successfully closing.
- Failures involving the operating system's password vault are now better handled.

releases.name: Ghost: Developer Preview III
releases.body:
This is the last preview, folks! There's been a bunch of changes since the second preview - and as always, we'd appreciate feedback.

#### Changelog
- Feature: A shiny Auto-Updater! Ghost Desktop is now able to update itself.
- Feature: Preferences! There's not much yet, but you can already see the status of your updates, delete all saved data, and see who the beautiful people are who built Ghost Desktop.
- Feature: Jump directly to blogs by choosing them in the window, dock, or Windows Start Menu icon menu.
- Feature: Blog icons are now given a random color. Also, a right click on the icon allows you to get a new random color.
- Feature: Ghost now remembers the window's state and should reopen itself with the same location and position it was when you closed it.
- Bugfix: A blog's name is now displayed correctly in the window title, even if it contains non-ASCII characters.
- Bugfix: Dragging an image onto Ghost no longer opens the image (we're still working on drag & drop uploads)
- Bugfix: Mixed HTTP/HTTPS content in an individual blog is now supported
- Bugfix: Removing all blogs reopens the "welcome, let's add a blog" UI

Also, for the geeks: We added a buuuunch of tests.

releases.name: Ghost: Developer Preview II
releases.body:
While Ghost Desktop is not yet ready for consumers, we would love to get some feedback and help from the developer community. The development build resembles closely what will be the first public release, but we want to make sure that we got as many :eyes: as possible on the app before we actually release it. [Go ahead, download the dev build now](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost-Desktop/releases) - and [report issues](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost-Desktop/issues) wherever you see them!

**Changelog**
- Fixed a DLL compilation issue on Windows, which rendered Ghost unable to communicate with the operating system's credentials vault.

releases.name: Ghost: Developer Preview
releases.body: While Ghost Desktop is not yet ready for consumers, we would love to get some feedback and help from the developer community. The development build resembles closely what will be the first public release, but we want to make sure that we got as many :eyes: as possible on the app before we actually release it. **[Go ahead, download the dev build now](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost-Desktop/releases) - and [report issues](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost-Desktop/issues) wherever you see them!
